alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 1:35PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson and Orleans. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Avondale, Metairie, Marrero, Harvey, Jefferson, Harahan, Westwego, Bridge City, Elmwood, River Ridge, Waggaman, Estelle, Woodmere and New Orleans Armstrong Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
